intro: Bobua atroviridis, commonly known as the black-veined bobua, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its dark green, velvety leaves with prominent black veins, giving it a striking appearance. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and unique foliage, it is cultivated in tropical gardens and greenhouses.
